rComments: If you don't find whatever he's teaching about interesting, good luck paying attention in this class, because the lectures are honestly not super engaging. But the professor is a genuinely nice person and gives really detailed, honest feedback on assignments. You'll also definitely need to participate in lectures & take notes to pass.
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', 'Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: His lectures are dry, but he openly does not like online classes so he may be better in person. His expectations for assignments are clear, however he is a hard marker. As a 3rd yr taking this course I expected better marks but he is definitely harder on students. Is much more specific than other english profs when it comes to MLA

he's a good prof, his lectures can be a little long but he gives breaks every little while. do the readings, and go to his office hours if you have questions, he's very helpful, especially with essays. his exam was very related to lecture material so pay attention/take notes.
This professor is very kind and is willing to review our essays before we hand them in. His feedback is extremely helpful and I would take any class with him again.

Long lectures but he's clearly passionate about the topics and open to discussion which make classes enjoyable. Willing to look over your papers and give feedback before you submit which is very helpful for making sure you're on the right track. Great prof just prepare for lots of readings

Hes very passionate about lessons, and what makes it so much better is that he is willing to check a first paragraph of every essay and give a feedback, yeah the class is difficult, but actually enjoyable

He now abducts 5% per class you skip... We also had one quiz per week (plus our readings and obligatory movies), so I'm not lying when I say that it was a lot. BUT! I loved how passionate he was about the movies we talked about, and he always quickly answered to my emails and took time after class to answer to my questions. Very accomodating too.

Voldemort. Professor Allen is very monotone and his lectures do not appropriately cover the content from the assigned readings. He often spends at least half the class getting through only a few slides, talking about MLA style or irrelevant information which does not help paper writing. Very hard marker on papers. Avoid at all costs. Enough said.
Fair grader, but his lectures are typically dry and uneventful. However, the course material is fairly interesting, as well as the essay topics. Overall, a decent prof.

I am a fan of English courses and don't mind writing essays and all that stuff. Prof Allen made this class relevant and served as a very good transition from high school into university. He goes over things that some would think are common knowledge (tenses in writing, commas, semi-colons, splices, etc.) I really think that he helped my writing.

He's a great prof to run a seminar because he offers really good discussion and is open to many different interpretations. That being said, do not take a seminar with him if you're shy/don't like participation. He really values participation and is not afraid to call on you! He's also a tough grader.

overall is a good prof but is extremely monotone and ends up talking about nothing during lectures. Was an easy grade, he is a fair grader and made it very clear what he wanted in papers. Had two textbooks for my semester class with him and both were used regularly and even during the discussion groups

His voice is very monotone so make sure you get a goodnight sleep before class or else you will fall asleep. Great marker and gives good feedback. He is very approachable and will respond to your email ASAP.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback', 'Participation matters']

rComments: He's a tough grader at times but very clear on his expectations. Really helpful if you seek him out. I really enjoyed his lectures. Would definitely take a class with him again.

All in all, he is a very nice prof, even though some lectures were a bit boring. We received constructive and very useful feedback on the assignments and the exams are also doable if you do all of the readings.
He was alright. pretty tough grader but he'll help you out.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback', 'Tough grader']

rComments: He is the most boring professor I've ever encountered. Very monotone, very dry, very awkward sense of humour. Wouldn't take a class with this professor again.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Participation matters', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: a lot of work, he assigned a lot of essays but was very helpful. quick to respond to emails and will accommodate you  if you require office hours. made a really boring class much more enjoyable.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Gives good feedback', 'So many papers']

rComments: Really nice guy, super approachable! But he's really monotone and boring like he can put you to sleep in .5 seconds. Fair marker though, fairly easy class. DGD was mandatory, but not the lectures.
Great prof for a seminar! Very encouraging and a great marker. The class was very interesting. I would recommend him to any English student looking for a great seminar!
Positive experience with the class and the professor. Very approachable.
If a monotone voice and dry humour interest and compell you then you will enjoy Thomas Allen's class. I found him very boring and a hard marker. Not reccommended.
Great prof.  Very helpful, funny, nice, knoweldgeable.  He's the first prof I ever had at Ottawa U and I still remember how much I loved his class.

This was one of the best college classes I've taken.  Prof. Allen is an extremely intelligent person and has a very good understanding of the material.  He communicates effectively and gets his points across easily.  Great class.
Awesome teacher. Nice, easy to talk to, always ready to help. Encourages participation, and really seems to enjoy his work. Not the easiest marker, but put the effort in and you'll do good.
A really nice guy, fair marker, extremely helpful.  Chooses a wide variety of readings from different types of authors.  Lectures were interesting and promoted class discussion.

Really good guy, easy enough to listen to, some of the readings were pretty dull but that might just be the course. Totally knows his stuff though, and then some. Genuinely nice, totally helpful, though a little too specific in terms of essays, etc.

Speaks quietly and sometimes seems unsure of himself. He is really passionate though, and someitmes humerous. He is very clear in his lectures and is sympathetic to his students. Seems to be a really great guy.

Great Proff, takes a dull english class to the next level. Interesting, and most importantly non-condescending, treats class like equals. Nice guy, makes english more interesting by providing interesting insights and he knows his stuff!! I would definitley take a class with him again!
A good guy
